title: Diffusion-Sharpening: Fine-tuning Diffusion Models with Denoising Trajectory Sharpening
author: Ye Tian (Peking University), Ling Yang (Princeton University), Xinchen Zhang (Tsinghua University), Yunhai Tong (Peking University), Mengdi Wang (Princeton University), Bin Cui (Peking University), ...
relevance_why: The proposed methods of trajectory-level optimization and reward-based fine-tuning can be applied to audio and speech tasks, where conditioning on specific audio features becomes crucial.
background: This work focuses on enhancing the performance of generative diffusion models by optimizing the sampling trajectories used in the denoising process, allowing for better alignment with user preferences and application-specific requirements.
contribution: This paper introduces Diffusion-Sharpening to solve the challenge of aligning diffusion models with user preferences by analyzing and optimizing the entire sampling trajectory, achieving superior training and inference efficiency.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often focus on optimizing individual timesteps or incur high computational costs during inference.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by employing a path integral framework to evaluate and select optimal trajectories, thus reducing inference costs while maximizing performance across diverse metrics.

key_innovation: Introduces a novel framework to refine the entire sampling trajectory rather than individual timesteps, which ensures more robust generative outcomes.
real_world_impact: The framework can enhance various applications involving generative tasks such as image and audio synthesis, leading to higher user satisfaction and efficiency in model fine-tuning.

new_terms.path integral framework: **Path integral framework** refers to a mathematical method that allows for the evaluation of trajectories in a stochastic process, useful in optimizing sampling paths for generative models.
